attributes.action: Make the defacing of or vandalism on War Memorials  a hate crime.
attributes.additional_details: We have seen numerous examples recently.  The most prominent recent examples being graffiti on the National War Memorial, The Cenotaph in Whitehall and the Statue of Sir Winston Churchill in Parliament Square.  But there have been a number of other examples in cities, towns and even villages across the country. Whilst some are acts of mindless vandalism, many are politically motivated and fuelled by hate - as much as spoken words. This will enable the courts to impose more appropriate sentences.
attributes.background: Change the law to include attacks on War Memorials and memorials to public figures in the definition of a "hate crime".

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make it a specific offence to desecrate national flags, symbols and monuments: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325545

Protect all monuments and statues from being taken down: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325814
